newsitem.title: MEXICO: BBV-Probursa says new mortgage plan soon.
newsitem.headline: BBV-Probursa says new mortgage plan soon.

text.p: Mexican-based financial group BBV-Probursa said on Thursday it was to launch a mortgage debt relief program to cost up to 500 million pesos.

"We will launch it in the coming days and the aim is to adjust over time the amount of credit in line with real asset value and encourage debt payment," Information Manager Antonio Galdiz said at a news conference.
Galdiz added BBV-Probursa would absorb the loss of more than one-half of its past-due loans portfolio, which totalled some 800 million pesos at the end of June, in order to update mortgage debts.

BBV-Probursa CEO Miguel Navas said the total cost of the plan could reach 500 million pesos, however, because all mortgage debtors could enter the program, which entailed discounts on outstanding debt and monthly payments.
The group's banking division held mortgage debts totalling 2.747 billion pesos at the close of June.
Spanish bank Banco Bilbao Vizcaya owns a majority stake in BBV-Probursa.
